TextView.android:text: Mental health encompasses emotional, psychological, and social well-being. It influences the way we feel, act, and think. It is a critical determinant factor when it comes to handling everyday stress and pressure from our environment. In today's world, it is essential to have the ability to deal with emotional and mental distress from internal and external environments. Emotional well-being is crucial at every stage of life, whether childhood, adolescence, or adulthood. Recent studies show that mental health issues are a vital concern when it comes to the younger generation (Perich, T., Andriessen, K., 2023). Many college students are unable to deal with pressure, and as a result, suicide is the second leading cause of death among university students (Danowitz and K. Beddoes, 2020). Depression worldwide is on the rise, with more than 340 million people worldwide affected. After cardiovascular diseases, depression has become the second leading cause of disability (Brailovskaia, J., 2023). A typical professional treatment for mental health problems involves seeking help from psychiatrists, therapists, psychologists, and counsellors who might prescribe anti-depression medication (Goldman H., and Grob N.G., 2006).Mental health encompasses emotional, psychological, and social well-being.
